data: Coins are a fundamental part of any level. Whether it be just to guide the player, to mark where the player has already been, or most importantly, just to be a fun collectable!
The Goal Orb, upon touched, will clear the level. It is droppable by bosses, but can be placed seperately as well.
Item Block always have an item to give to the player! Sometimes it's just a coin, sometimes a power-up, sometimes an extra life. You can set what's inside it!
Empty Brick Blocks can be destroyed by big Mario by jumping into it from below. If it contains an item, it will behave the same way as an Item Block.
The Flip Block or Turn Block will flip over once hit, allowing the player (and other objects) to pass, jump or fall through it!
The player can bounce from a Note Block to reach higher areas, much like the Springboard. If it contains an item, it will be released from below.
Boing! Green Springboards can be carried around and bring the player to higher-up areas of the level. Yellow Springboards do not have any gravity.
Upon pressed, the P-Switch will: turn coins into empty Brick Blocks, empty Brick Blocks into coins, spawn P-Tiles, and make P-Doors appear! Oh, and you can carry it!
Hello? Who's there? Ah, time to give the player some handy information about this level! That is what this handy block allows you to do.
Keys can be carried and used to unlock locked doors. When inserted into a single keyhole, they can end the level as well.
